title: I'm Having a Hard Time Finding a Good Jungle Keystone & Rune Set
body:
Hey everybody, hope you're having a fantastic day so far and that it continues that way.

Disclaimer: I want to start this off by saying that I'm not one to play ranked. I'm a casual person who plays for fun. I learned when I cracked under the pressure of either needing to carry or relying on others to carry me, and getting hardstuck bronze that ranked and competitive just wasn't for me. So keep in mind while responding that I'm not a competitive player, and even though I want to win, it's norms.

Now that I've got that out of the way, I want to bring up an issue that I've been having while working on my season 8 builds for my favorite junglers like Master Yi, {{champion:11}} Jax, {{champion:24}}  and sometimes my good pal Mums {{champion:32}} , among numerous others.

The problem is that all of the keystones pretty much are centered around interacting with champions, and I'm having a hard time choosing keystones that can help me with a healthy clear because of it. The reason I'm not super interested in keystones that interact with champs is because I really love the split push style of jungling. So it's really disappointing when I go through the keystones that might be good on different champs, and seeing that nearly every one of them have something to do with champions. The only one I found that doesn't really have anything to do with champs is unsealed spellbook, which, on a split-push jungle build I suppose could work if you decide to swap to tele...

But that's about it. I really want to run lethal tempo but I also don't want to have to be fighting a champ to break the 2.5 cap. It's mildly frustrating, and I'd like to know what you guys would suggest. Thank you for reading, and thank you again if you respond!

TL:DR; I'm a casual player, and I prefer to play the split push jungle playstyle with my junglers, but I'm having a hard time finding a keystone that would be good for clear and for split pushing, and doesn't require interaction with champs. Thanks!

replies.body: To be honest, I'm glad Riot took this path. The absence of any helpful jungle clear rune finally solved the neverending problem with diversity in the jungle: every champion shoehorned into AtkSpeed and armor runes. What I learnt by jungling is that as long as there is anything that benefits your early clear, everyone would be forced into into it.

Yeahhhh this is what we found with a lot of our early runes testing, honestly. 

We didn't want to hard lock ALL junglers into a single keystone (or even single keystone per Path). Anything we tried that had an effect on clear speed in the keystone slot did just that and effectively killed any keystone choice a jungler had. 

All keystones, for every position, fundamentally ask how you as a player would like to interact with other players, though many of the regular runes can adjust stats that would impact jungling.

What I'm having trouble with is the tanky keystones. If I can't use aftershock illaoi, garen, morde and etc... and I don't want grasp... I'm left with guardian... which ummm yea.... I wouldn't mind grasp but that 4 seconds in combat is kind of a huge deterrent.
I get what you mean, but as someone who plays Grasp on Garen, combat also includes with minions. As long as you’re farming, you’ll normally have Grasp up all the time to go in for trades.
I can't really accept your argument, because if you are only last hitting minions you cannot rely on it to be up for a trade. Also, what about when you aren't in lane with minions?
It works out better if you are building lots of defensive items.  It's not ment to feel good/noticeable until you can commit to becoming as tanky as possible.

But it is also mostly a damage keystone... So 1 its not reliable like aery or press the attack/etc... but 2 it also doesn't really do anything to bolster tank stats. Its just delayed behind a 4 seconds in combat gate...
So gaining HP doesn't make you tanky and regenerating HP doesn't make you harder to kill?  Am I reading you correctly or can you elaborate a bit more?

I'm talking about the bruiser class of champions. For tanks its a great keystone. But bruisers tend to have less hp, so the heal isn't very effective on them, and the stacking hp doesn't tend to amount to much unless you are forcing trades that maybe shouldn't be happening.
That sounds more like an itemazation problem rather than runes.  Try changing items before giving up on a rune because it isn't working for you.

So you are saying I should be building full tank Illaoi, Morde, Garen? Tank garen is almost a meme at this point with how everyone builds lethality. Noone builds full tank illaoi, and most morde players agree that its best to just build full  ap damage on morde...  with a few people holding out on the triforce stereks build yet. I don't think its an itemization issue. 

Last season you could get your tank stats from runes, and then get away with being tanky while having more damage. This season you have to dedicate yourself to being tanky to get the tank runes to work. To top it off you don't get enough damage stats out of the damage trees to just take damage runes and defensive items... They pretty much eliminated the bruiser/juggernaut classes and pigeon holed them into building full tank or full damage. 

Inb4 you say what about Stereks/black cleaver. Those are mixed tank/damage items. There isn't a good equivalent for ap classes like morde. I just want to build my two defense items, and 3 damage items and be just tanky enough that I can get to them and do my job. Unlike last season no runes allow me to do that.

Actually, I find a a lot of success personally with off-tank Garen. I mean, you still build Black Cleaver and stuff, but it’s not THAT bad. Normally I go Resolve/Precision with Grasp, Conditioning, and Legend: Tenacity. I build Cleaver, Sunfire, Mercs, Sterak’s, and then build conditional (not necessarily in that order, of course). I win more often than I lose with it.

Also, I would suggest that you consider altering what you max first with abilities based upon the matchup. If you’ve got a lane opponent you need to poke down, you max Q first. When dealing with duelists like Jax, who are going to be aggressive, you max E and take a point in W early. I’ve even taken W first on rare instances where I have to turtle and play farm simulator.

Just try mixing things up. Remember that Grasp does limitless increase your health, so you’ll be tanky mid/late in most cases.

Plus one for solid reason.  With durability down around the board it feels very important to buy the things you need rather than pretend they have to be there in the beginning.  

I like taking Resolve/Precision too.  Build something like Titanic Hydra with as much resistance and HP as I can get and let my damage creep ever higher as the game goes on.  With those runes I try to take Demolish and Last Stand so even if I'm in a fight or not I have something solid to contribute.

With a thought out rune page, yes, that's exactly what I'm asking of you.  Understanding what you need out of a proper page is very important now and this is exactly the time you should be testing out each rune to know why you want it.

Last season.  There isn't a point or argument here because it no longer exists, all I can ask is that you move on and adapt.

Taking Mordekaiser as the example there are plenty of good selections for him.  While Stereks does some to mind the more obvious picks would be Liandries, Wits End and Maw of Malmortious.  By no means would I ever get all of them but one is more than enough to fill in with a rune like Last Stand and Gathering Storm.

But I need tank stats out of the runes, of which I cannot get. Which is what I said in my first comment. Conditioning does not cover those stats needs, and as for the keystones they are almost unusable. 

Guardian feels the best, but it doesn't work in a solo lane, and convincing a teammate to help me proc it is difficult. 
Grasp Feels like shit because I can't stack the hp, and the in combat sustain doesn't do enough to make it worth taking. 
Can't get aftershock.
But items don't give you enough durability to do anything even if you use runes to supplement damage and build tanky. Its just not there because of how much more valuable damage items are.

Then I dont know what to tell you.  The durability is in the items and the runes are there to supplement your damage based on those items.  If you are not willing to try it then stop asking for the changes that clearly are not coming.

My biggest problem though is there are a number of runes that lose a lot of value because they are designed around lane interactions.  Overgrowth comes to mind.  Undying grasp as well.  Taste of blood and couple more.  So now you've got things that would be a good fit if you were a laner being a bad fit.

>All keystones, for every position, fundamentally ask how you as a player would like to interact with other players, though many of the regular runes can adjust stats that would impact jungling.

The problem this philosophy has with junglers, and I think it's a fair one overall ignoring them, is that junglers just don't have the same interactions that other classes do.  I'm surprised you guys didn't add a path just for junglers.

Yea, but if you aren't auto pushing, and forcing trades constantly a lot of the runes offer nothing. I see no reason to do anything but last hit early, unless I'm an early kill champ. 

I don't want the minions under the enemy tower so I'm not going to be in combat long enough to proc grasp unless I either am 100% certain I'm going to win the trade, or I'm auto pushing which again I just said I don't want to do.

Thing is, how can you balance the keystones for all champions if all of them are based on PVP interaction and two champions out of ten have next to 0 PVP interaction for the first 10 minutes of the game? 

A jungler might gank 3 times in the first 10 minutes of the game. That's 3 potential uses of a keystone, compared to something like Kleptomancy which can easily be proc'd 3 times per wave. If you have to balance the power of keystones around their repeated activation in trades in the laning phase, how are they supposed to provide enough benefit to a jungler who isn't engaging in extended trading?

they actually did make something to help with the consective use issue that your bringing up. Almost everything in the domination tree is about burst damage but electricute and predator have long cd that work with the jg occational gank pattern and dark harvest stacks faster in the jg than in lane and may require a little thought into how a gank goes off in order to use its proc since you can only hold onto it for 30s pre 150 stacks
20 seconds actually.

Yi and Jax should probably take PTA and Amumu should take aftershock. Even if you are split-pushing with Yi and Jax you will still eventually encounter enemy champions and PTA is the best for dueling them. Amumu should probably take aftershock so you can become even tankier during teamfights.

why not go spellbook ? Faster Smites for early game to stay more healthy, teleport / ghost in mid / late game for good split pushing greatness? 

There's also dark harvest which those stacks work on enemy towers as well. So that's also good for split pushers.

If you are having trouble clearing  and staying healthy, try to resolve rune that +5 armor and +5% armor upon healing. That effect get procced by the jungle items.
If you want a rune set that just makes your jungle clear better, Summoner Specialist gives you more smites and Inspiration gives you higher stats bonuses than the other trees.

Agreed, the keystones don't proc on monsters
they shouldn't proc on minons but like dark harvest, aftershock, etc should proc on monsters

If you REALLY REALLY want to avoid champion combat I recomend predator. 
It gives 45% move speed for 15 seconds. You can use movespeed to escape tricky situations making it perfect when you are backdooring.
Its like having an extra summonerspell : {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:4}} +"{{summoner:6}} "

The Domination path also has some nice tools for backdoor such as
-Vision: Zombie Ward, Ghost Poro, Ingenious Hunter(this one also reduces Predator's cooldown)
-Movement Speed: Relentless Hunter

amumu can probably use aftershock pretty well.

Jax is definitely a PTA user, yi can do it, cowsep was messing around with glacial augment, seemed really useful for early ganks/invades, and helps a bit later sticking to people.

fleet of foot work works on jg camps and helps keep you healthy and the move speed it gives can be pretty good so maybe going persision into resolve for demolish and build a heavy bruiser attackspeed spit push build might help

i dont play yi much but for jax id prolly go ffw-triumph-bloodline-coup de grace and demolish-and any other rune for your prefrense

this should give decent sustain and ample split pushing power

Keystones don't really matter as much as the little runes because of the particular stats they bring. (Life Steal or Attack Speed.) (Damage or health.) 

It's really about what you want to take when jungling. Most typically run with the domination path either as the primary or secondary, but Precision helps basic attack focused junglers like Yi and Jax.
I know it's not the best, but eyeball collector is good for JG I know it's not a keystone, but it's a start.
